intro: Pultenaea elusa, commonly known as the slender pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, spreading growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to the dry conditions of its native habitat. Pultenaea elusa is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
